part.name: train
part.narration: 1986. On the cold, hard floor of a French connector lie Asami and Jacques, bedsheets askew. The lady breathes hard; the gentleman breathes smoke. Asami fidgets.
part.line: The clocks are frowning at me.
part.narration: Jacques yawns. Jacques rises. Asami yells! She seizes the sheets and covers her mate's shame. Also covering herself, she lingers but a stumble away.The controls appear for the first time. This is the Player's first interaction with the game. This must happen less than ten seconds after startup. Jacques is the Leading Character. The Player can walk around the train as Jacques. Asami follows extremely close, covering the man's body with a towel.There are few clocks. Calendars litter the train's walls.When the player nears Jacques to a calendar, the camera begins to zoom in on the calendar.
part.line: Clocks shall not frown on the boldest of mates. Great spawn are born in spontaneity.
Is it mere "spontaneity" at such an hour?
Think not of an hour, but of the year.
I am in need of succession.
Typical father, exerting his unfulfilled desires on unborn children.
part.narration: Bracing the shake of the cab, Jacques stares down the sky.
part.line: Unfulfilled? Nonsense. Someone must take my place on the throne.
That someone will be my son.
My talented, brilliant visionary of a son.
part.comment: By the time Jacques says this, the camera will have completely zoomed in on a calendar. A song begins to play. The environment makes an abrupt change in synchronization to each note in the lead guitar riff. The calendar changes. The date changes. The wallpaper changes. The day-light changes.
